item.title: Rabbit populations boom in parts of Australia as ideal conditions see pests return
item.description: A resurgence of rabbit populations following recent rainfall is driving experts to urge for increased control measures.

item.title: Daniil Medvedev wins Almaty Open, Elena Rybakina closes in on WTA Finals
item.description: Daniil Medvedev claims his first ATP Tour tournament win since 2023, while Elena Rybakina's push to reach the WTA Finals gathers momentum.

item.title: All the numbers behind Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st century
item.description: The winner for the Top 100 Books has been announced. What do the votes behind it say about us?

item.title: Millions being spent as Australia prepares for deadly H5 strain of bird flu
item.description: The bird flu outbreak that saw millions of chickens culled and a national shortage of eggs has been declared eradicated, but scientists warn a much deadlier strain of avian influenza could arrive this spring.

item.title: Healthscope under fire over proposal to farm millions in employees' tax benefits
item.description: In-receivership hospital group Healthscope is taking radical steps to stay alive, converting to a charity and proposing to take up to 90 per cent of a benefit intended to reduce workers' taxable income.

item.title: Multiple sclerosis support group tries to fill gaps as Northern Territory services dwindle
item.description: Being diagnosed with multiple sclerosis can often be an isolating experience, and even more so for those in Darwin who lack access to on-the-ground supports. Despite these barriers, a group of local women have created a support group to help fill the service gap.

item.title: England records four-run Women's World Cup win over India to join Australia in semifinals
item.description: England secures its Women's World Cup semifinal spot with a tense four-run win over tournament co-host India at Indor's Holkar Stadium.

item.title: Tourism dollars roll into Carnamah a year after arrival of big tractor
item.description: One year on from its opening, the orange icon has brought people from all over Australia — and the world — to WA's Midwest.

item.title: Police probing claims Prince Andrew tried to smear sexual assault accuser Virginia Giuffre
item.description: British police say they're probing claims that Prince Andrew asked an officer to dig up dirt for a smear campaign against his sexual assault accuser Virginia Giuffre.

item.title: India backs Virat Kohli to rebound after ODI duck against Australia in Perth series opener
item.description: Virat Kohli failed to score in the opening men's ODI in Perth. However, his India teammates expect their ex-skipper to quickly recapture his best form.

item.title: Holiday from Hospital virtual reality to transport patients to Australia's north-west
item.description: A leukaemia survivor designs a VR program that will help patients travel to some of Australia's iconic locations from their hospital beds.

item.title: Richmond is starting to play good footy. But in AFLW's short season there's no time left to build momentum
item.description: After a 0-7 start to the season, Richmond are starting to notch wins on the board. But it's too late for much momentum to build in the short women's season.

item.title: Some scientists challenge logic of Victoria's fuel reduction burns
item.description: Dry winter conditions have resulted in extra fuel reduction burns in regional Victoria ahead of the fire season. But some scientists are asking if fuel burns are the best way to reduce fire risk.

item.title: Melt Festival is giving queer artists a space to be themselves
item.description: Brisbane's Melt Festival has rapidly expanded in the past decade, inviting numerous venues into the celebration of queer artistry.

item.title: Sam Kerr backed by Matildas coach Joe Montemurro to make impact in friendlies
item.description: Sam Kerr will return to the Matildas fold off the back of limited minutes at Chelsea, but coach Joe Montemurro is confident she will shine.

item.title: Mossman sugarcane industry on its last legs as haulage deal ends
item.description: A deal between Mossman sugarcane growers and a mill 100 kilometres away has been deemed unviable, leaving farmers without a place to send their product after this season.

item.title: What we know about the Louvre jewellery heist
item.description: Here are the details on the items stolen in the Louvre heist that unfolded in broad daylight in Paris.

item.title: Cargo plane slides off runway in Hong Kong killing two airport staff
item.description: The flight arriving from Dubai was landing at Hong Kong International Airport when it skidded off the runway, leading to the deaths of two men in a vehicle on the ground, according to police.

item.title: Deep Time, a story 65,000 years in the making
item.description: ABC's Story Lab team has created an interactive tool to help Australians better understand the ancient history of our continent and its First Nations peoples. Look back at our blog to see how it works.

item.title: Samoa down to 17 fit players after Pacific Championships loss to New Zealand
item.description: Samoa's brutal loss to New Zealand leaves them needing to call fresh troops into their squad, with the Pacific powerhouse down to just 17 fit players.

item.title: Central Land Council CEO Lesley Turner sues senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price over defamation claims
item.description: A seven-day Federal Court defamation case, alleging senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price "trampled" the reputation of an NT land council leader, has begun in Darwin.

item.title: Has Australia just killed its cultural cringe?
item.description: How wonderful for Australian writers to receive this recognition from the very people who consume their work, as part of ABC Radio National's Top 100 Books countdown.

item.title: Election campaign donation laws would have blocked $8m in Climate 200 funding
item.description: Climate 200 would have been blocked from making $8.34 million in donations to independent candidates if new election donation laws were in place at the 2025 poll.

item.title: New England voters divided by Barnaby Joyce's flirtation with One Nation
item.description: Support for the politician remains strong in his electorate despite his apparent flirtation with One Nation, a party enjoying a surge in popularity in the seat of New England.

item.title: Patients at centre of suspected rat poisoning cluster in south-east Queensland are all from Logan. This is what we know
item.description: South-east Queensland authorities are continuing to investigate the source of the cluster, with contact tracing underway.

item.title: Prince Andrew is no longer the Duke of York but will likely remain a prince. Here's why
item.description: The second son of the late Queen Elizabeth II will no longer be called the Duke of York, but he still remains a prince and in the line of succession, despite calls for his remaining title to be stripped. Here's why.

item.title: Temporary bans on fishing popular species floated to address dwindling populations off WA coast
item.description: A temporary ban on fishing iconic species, including WA dhufish and pink snapper, could be on the table as the state government scrambles for solutions to WA's at-risk fish populations.

item.title: Mitch Marsh dismisses suggestion he should open for Australia in the first Ashes Test
item.description: Michael Vaughan wants Mitch Marsh opening the batting for Australia in the Ashes but it would require a serious leap of faith from Test selectors.

item.title: NSW police searching for armed bank robber who threatened Bendigo Bank staff and customers
item.description: Police are still hunting for a man responsible for a bank robbery in south-west New South Wales.

item.title: Australian and New Zealand shearers set new world record with 2,301 sheep shorn in eight hours
item.description: A new world record for sheep shearing has been set in southern New South Wales by a team of five shearers who clipped on average a sheep a minute for eight hours straight.

item.title: Fast and easy dinners for busy weeknights
item.description: Make life easier with some of our simplest dinner recipes, including a 15-minute creamy pasta and air-fryer salmon fillets.

item.title: Voter turnout dips again at 2025 WA Local Government elections amid calls for mandatory voting
item.description: The number of West Australians who voted at the weekend's local government elections is slightly down on previous years, following calls for participation to become mandatory.

item.title: Chinese fighter jet released flares 'very close' to Australian aircraft
item.description: Defence Minister Richard Marles says the incident was "unsafe and unprofessional" and the government has made representations to China.

item.title: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr says it has been a 'challenging first year' in minority government
item.description: The ACT's chief minister brushes off criticism that his government is "tired", but acknowledges the 12 months since the election have been "difficult" for the territory.

item.title: Tasmanians buffeted by spring winds, but conditions not unusual, BOM says
item.description: Springtime typically means gardens come to life and the winter chill eases — for Tasmanians, it also means whatever isn't nailed down might get blown away.

item.title: John Simmons was convicted of fraud but no one stopped him being a military advocate who ripped off vulnerable veterans
item.description: A convicted "fraudster" has been able to represent vulnerable veterans, scamming them in the process.

item.title: The moment authorities move a piece of space junk that crashed in Western Australia.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Inquest finds death of Mount Barker man waiting for ambulance 'potentially' preventable
item.description: The cardiac arrest death of a man who waited more than 20 minutes for an ambulance could have been "potentially" prevented if a paramedic had not interfered with the dispatch process and had help arrived sooner, a South Australian coroner has found.

item.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of detaining scientist ahead of Antarctic conference in Hobart
item.description: A diplomatic row has broken out at an international conservation conference in Hobart after Ukraine accused Russia of detaining one of its scientists for alleged security threats.

item.title: Coroner probes death of Alice Springs psychiatric patient who was repeatedly sedated
item.description: NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage is investigating the death of a 33-year-old Alice Springs mother of three who was unable to be revived after repeated medical sedations in 2023.

item.title: Federal politics: Trump's AUKUS remarks the 'words we have been looking for': SA premier — as it happened
item.description: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas says the US president's comments endorsing the AUKUS pact were the "words we have been looking for".

item.title: Prince Andrew, Harry, Meghan and King Edward VIII show what losing a title says about the House of Windsor
item.description: Superstar royal biographer Andrew Morton on Prince Andrew, royal scandals and the huge hole Harry and Meghan have left in the monarchy.

item.title: Australians turning to ChatGPT and other AI for financial advice warned to tread with caution
item.description: When Georgina Doll was looking to buy a home, generative artificial intelligence was one of the sources she turned to for advice.

item.title: How bankers have learned to operate outside the rules in the murky world of private credit
item.description: In recent months, there's been a growing focus on private credit, the alter ego of private equity, and the potential it may have to destabilise the system.

item.title: Trump praises Australia and takes swipe at Rudd during White House meeting with Albanese
item.description: Donald Trump lavishes praise on Australia and Anthony Albanese during the pair's landmark meeting in Washington, but takes a swipe at a former prime minister in the room.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Weapons maker Saab 'directly linked' to human rights harm over missile at Lake Hart
item.description: Traditional owners win a decision against a multinational weapons manufacturer after finding one of the company's missiles at a heritage site in the remote South Australian outback.

item.title: Independent distributors calling for action on perceived monopoly on remote food distribution
item.description: Independent wholesale distributors are calling on the federal government to reconsider the $50 million food subsidy scheme for remote stores that rolled out on July 1 of this year.

item.title: CSIRO voyage discovers new species of shark and crabs off West Australia's Gascoyne coast
item.description: After years of work, the CSIRO officially confirms the discovery of a glowing lantern shark and two armour-less crab species.

item.title: Natural Spoonfuls creator Stacey Hatfield dies after giving birth at home, family says
item.description: Stacey Hatfield's husband revealed the nutritionist and social media influencer died in September after giving birth to the couple's first child.

item.title: Sri Lanka scores World Cup win over Bangladesh following stunning final over
item.description: Sri Lanka remains a chance of progressing in the Women's Cricket World Cup, but Bangladesh is out after an extraordinary finish in Navi Mumbai.

item.title: Vocalist Samara Joy is taking the jazz world by storm and she's bringing some new music to Australia
item.description: Samara Joy has been compared to singers like Ella Fitzgerald and Sarah Vaughan. She's performing in Australia for the first time and bringing some new music.

item.title: WA government asks EPA to investigate water taken from Pilbara aquifer
item.description: Traditional owners and pastoralists in WA's Pilbara are hoping a government-ordered review into the usage of a significant aquifer will better protect it.

item.title: Premier Chris Minns announces 'in principle' $190m deal to take over Northern Beaches Hospital
item.description: Joe Massa's parents, Elouise and Danny, have advocated for management changes of the Northern Beaches Hospital since their son's death there last year.

item.title: Strawberry supplies expected to return to normal after weather extremes
item.description: Queensland strawberry growers are finishing their season early due to hot weather, while cold temperatures have delayed ripening in the south.

item.title: Political donations for Tasmania's federal election candidates disclosed in AEC returns
item.description: A $100,000 donation from a sole donor was one of 212 declared by anti-salmon campaigner Peter George in his federal politics tilt, newly released Australian Electoral Commission returns show.

item.title: The Mona Lisa, a gold toilet and now the Louvre's royal jewels: a fascinating history of art heists
item.description: This latest heist at the Louvre highlights the vulnerability of objects in public collections. The irony is they are often gifted to such institutions for safekeeping.

item.title: Trump tells Rudd 'I don't like you', reportedly offers forgiveness off-camera
item.description: President Donald Trump has told Australia's ambassador to the US, Kevin Rudd, "I don't like you, and I probably never will" during a meeting with Anthony Albanese at the White House.

item.title: How the genre of agricultural livestock art became so popular
item.description: An oil painting of an enormous bull is the star attraction at a regional Australian gallery. How did the genre of massive livestock art become so popular?

item.title: Amazon's AWS nears recovery after major outage disrupts apps, services worldwide
item.description: Amazon says its cloud computing unit at a US data centre has largely contained the fallout of a worldwide outage but some services are still reportedly disrupted.

item.title: How to uncover a workplace's culture before you take the job
item.description: Organisational culture drives worker satisfaction and performance, and it's about more than having a pool table in the lunch room.

item.title: Rare earths and critical minerals are used in everything from AI to medical tech, renewable energy and defence
item.description: Many of Australia's critical minerals can be found in a wide range of everyday items, but their application at the cutting edge of medical research and military intelligence are among the most strategically important reasons governments in the West have been trying to build a supply chain outside of China.

item.title: Chris Scott and Dean Cox named Victoria and Western Australia coaches for AFL Origin match
item.description: Chris Scott and Dean Cox are appointed as the AFL State of Origin coaches for next February's standalone exhibition match in Perth.

item.title: At the Louvre museum, all the gold and grandeur could not stop thieves with power tools
item.description: As French authorities scour Europe for some of their nation's most prized possessions, closer inspection of the Louvre museum itself reveals just how vulnerable it was to the type of attack that saw some of the French crown jewels disappear.

item.title: Former SA MP Troy Bell jailed for fraud and theft offending
item.description: Former South Australian MP Troy Bell will spend at least two-and-half years in jail for stealing more than $430,000 in public money meant for not-for-profit education organisations.

item.title: Donald Trump says critical minerals deal with Australia will produce 'so much' in race against China
item.description: Donald Trump and Anthony Albanese have inked a deal for "critical mineral and energy dominance" in a new partnership that will tip billions into mining projects in the US and Australia.

item.title: Fears for endangered Tasmanian crayfish species after 'unauthorised' earthworks
item.description: A creek in northern Tasmanian known to be home to the endangered giant freshwater crayfish has sustained "serious environmental harm" from land clearing and earthworks, the Environment Protection Agency has advised.

item.title: Magistrate rejects bid by accused rapist Michael Wilson to limit media coverage
item.description: A magistrate rejects an application by an accused rapist to prevent media from reporting on his alleged links with accused paedophile childcare worker Joshua Dale Brown.

item.description: Anthony Albanese leaves Washington with everything he came for: a deal on critical minerals, an assurance on AUKUS, and an alliance reaffirmed.

item.title: Trump ends AUKUS uncertainty with firm backing for Albanese
item.description: The US president's comments, made during his first in-person meeting with Anthony Albanese, put an end to months of speculation the US would back out of the agreement.

item.title: 'Cluster inquest' to be held into three patient suicides inside secure Brisbane mental health wards
item.description: A coronial inquest will be held into a "cluster" of three patient suicides inside the secure mental health wards of a major Brisbane hospital within just seven months.

item.title: Gungahlin United Football Club's debt exceeds $550,000 as closure leaves families 'totally blindsided'
item.description: Families have been left "totally blindsided" by the closure of Gungahlin United Football Club, as the club's debts more than double to $550,000.

item.title: Rockhampton's Fitzroy River passes initial testing to host 2032 Olympic events
item.description: Despite backlash from national and international bodies, Rockhampton's Fitzroy River receives positive feedback following initial water testing to prove it is up to standard to host rowing and canoeing events for the Brisbane Games.

item.title: Steve Smith says he's happy to give Sam Konstas batting advice ahead of the Ashes
item.description: As speculation swirls about Sam Konstas's spot in the Australian side ahead of the Ashes series, Steve Smith says he's happy to offer some advice to the struggling young gun about batting.

item.title: Virginia Giuffre haunted by 'ghosts' of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, Nobody's Girl memoir reveals
item.description: The late Virginia Giuffre's memoir details how she became involved in the shadowy world of notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, which led to her abuse at the hands of some of the world's "wealthiest and most powerful" people.

item.title: Perth's new Women and Babies Hospital being built on time, but could tip over $1.8b budget
item.description: Perth's new Women and Babies Hospital will open on time in 2029, the state government insists, but it says the $1.8 billion budget may blow out.

item.title: Sniper who killed Nick Martin at Kwinana Motorplex had killed before, David Pye murder trial hears
item.description: The assassin who murdered a former bikie boss in a sniper-style attack at a suburban speedway tells a Perth court he had killed people in targeted assassinations before.

item.title: When Donald Trump was ready to take his pound of flesh, Kevin Rudd was here to help
item.description: From his humble early days as a child reading Hansard in the regional Sunshine State pocket of Eumundi, Kevin Rudd has been preparing for this martyrdom. But the Passion Of The Kevin, when it came, was a million miles from home.

item.title: Jason Thomas King sentenced to life in prison for murder of landlord Susan Walker on Gold Coast
item.description: Jason Thomas King has been sentenced to life in prison after being found guilty of beating 74-year-old Susan Walker to death at her Gold Coast home, where he rented a room.

item.title: AFLW fights for fans' attention after a long men's season
item.description: One of the biggest challenges the AFLW faces is end-of-year "footy fatigue", according to diehard fans and industry insiders.

item.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy maintains his innocence on way to prison
item.description: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy is due to start serving a five-year sentence in prison, after being convicted of criminal conspiracy over a plan for late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to fund his electoral campaign.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sanae Takaichi becomes Japan's first female PM, but some say it is not a win for women
item.description: In the world of male-dominated politics, Sanae Takaichi has broken through an incredibly tough glass ceiling.

item.title: 'Sheraton' the crocodile set for new life after being found in Port Douglas resort pool
item.description: A young female crocodile is transported to a nearby wildlife park after causing a stir with a dip in a resort pool.

item.title: New board members appointed as Hobart Clinic works towards reopening
item.description: The new board has formally accepted a one-off $2 million funding offer from the Tasmanian government as it prepares to reopen the private mental health hospital.

item.title: Premier proposes laws to protect police and families from harassment
item.description: People found guilty of harassing or stalking a police officer or members of their family could face up to 10 years in prison under new laws proposed by the state government.

item.title: RACQ apologises to customers for problems with insurance renewal notices amid potential multi-million-dollar lawsuit
item.description: RACQ is facing allegations that more than half a million renewal notices were misleading or false, following an ABC investigation into its insurance arm.

item.title: State government refuses mandatory catch reporting for recreational fishers amid fish stock crisis
item.description: Western Australia's commercial fishing industry says live data is essential to improve the health of the state's fisheries, but the WA government and recreational groups say it is not needed.

item.title: Border Force seizes 3D-printed guns and parts in national crack down
item.description: An Australian Border Force operation leads to the seizure of more than 1,000 firearms and parts, including 281 made via 3D-printing processes.

item.title: Queensland police called in to investigate after five people hospitalised from rat poison
item.description: A public health probe has so far failed to identify the source of the poisonings, which authorities say aren't being treated as suspicious.

item.title: Timothy Hunt sentenced to life in prison over murder of missing Darwin man Tony Rowe
item.description: Timothy Hunt is sentenced to life in prison for the murder of missing Darwin man Tony Rowe, in what Justice Sonia Brownhill described as a "bizarre, brutal and cowardly attack".

item.title: Trump's take on China should shift the tone of war talk in Australia
item.description: Trump's remarks downplaying the threat of confrontation over Taiwan are highly significant for Australia. They should also shift the tone of much of the strategic discussion among China hawks on the prospects of imminent war.

item.title: WA government considers legislating 'climate targets', but refuses to explain those targets
item.description: The WA government is foreshadowing the introduction of legislated "climate targets" next year but refuses to clarify what those targets will be.

item.title: Friends' School staff member charged with child abuse offence after Hobart raids
item.description: The non-teaching member of staff at The Friends' School was arrested and charged following two police raids in Hobart.

item.title: Scott Boland takes heart from match-winning Sheffield Shield spell ahead of the Ashes
item.description: Australian Test paceman Scott Boland says his five-wicket spell for Victoria last Friday was important for his confidence ahead of the Ashes.

item.title: Canberra man jailed for part in 'cruel, calculated' attack on woman with baseball bat
item.description: A Canberra man has pleaded guilty to his part in a "cruel" and "premeditated" attack on a woman, helping trick her into a car before driving her around, hitting her with a baseball bat, choking her and demanding $10,000.

item.title: Kaurna ancestral remains re-buried in emotional repatriation ceremony
item.description: An emotional ceremony for the repatriation of Aboriginal remains that had been held by institutions, including the South Australian Museum, has been held in Adelaide's north at a site that is now a resting place for hundreds of Kaurna ancestors.

item.title: Senator Nampijinpa Price civil trial hears land council CEO's reputation took a 'sustained hit' after media coverage
item.description: On day two of the senator's defamation trial, a witness told the court the chief executive of one of the NT's largest land councils took a "sustained hit" to his reputation when news broke about an alleged no-confidence motion last year.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Kevin Rudd should not be sacked after Donald Trump's rebuke, Malcolm Turnbull insists
item.description: Former prime minister Malcoim Turnbull says any talk of removing Kevin Rudd as ambassador to the United States should be ignored.

item.description: Yarra City Council mayor Stephen Jolly says he will fight an assault charge linked to a local government election afterparty last November.

item.title: Injured Australian captain Alyssa Healy out of Women's Cricket World Cup match with England
item.description: Alyssa Healy suffers another injury at the pointy end of a World Cup, ruled out of Australia's clash against England with the finals on the horizon.

item.description: Millions of apps, websites and services rely on AWS, one of the world's largest cloud computing platforms. Here's what we know about the outage.

item.description: Brittany Higgins abandons her appeal of a WA Supreme Court finding that she defamed her ex-boss and former Liberal Senator Linda Reynolds in a series of social media posts.

item.description: The former financial adviser to Collingwood star Scott Pendlebury has racked up a multi-million dollar tax debt since 2021.

item.title: Scientists prepare to release captive adult Maugean skates as attention turns to captive breeding
item.description: From a specimen unexpectedly launching itself out of a tank, to another dying from a gastrointestinal blockage, and bite marks made during mating rituals, the ABC can reveal the challenges scientist face keeping the endangered Maugean skate species alive.

item.description: The vice-president urged Israel to have "a little bit of patience" with Hamas as the militant group tries to find the remains of deceased hostages.

item.title: Critical minerals industry cheers deal that will 'encourage greater investment' as stock prices swing
item.description: Australian critical minerals companies could expect more international and domestic investment in producing and processing following the deal, experts say, however, more investment is needed in refineries and magnet production.

item.title: Canberra man on trial for raping teenage girl calls co-accused a 'liar' in ACT Supreme Court
item.description: Lawyers for a Canberra man charged with raping a teenager in 2022 have told a jury there is a real chance if found guilty he would be taking the fall for someone else.

item.title: Industry warns building houses in Australia slower than it was a decade ago, construction targets missed
item.description: Industry experts warn – despite improvements – Australia will fail to meet its housing targets if skills shortages and regulatory barriers are not addressed.

item.title: A survivor of the digital wave and Parramatta's growth, independent record store celebrates 30 years
item.description: Tucked away at the end of an old arcade strip, a local record store has survived three decades of change, from new technology to the construction of Sydney's second CBD.

item.description: The federal government is celebrating the US president's emphatic backing of AUKUS, saying his statements should kill off speculation.

item.title: Electrical apprentices exposed to potentially deadly shocks due to lack of training, union says
item.description: One in eight electrical apprentices are being exposed to potentially deadly shocks at work, as the industry struggles with worker shortages, inadequate support and delays in training.

item.title: Louvre robbery not the first to resemble a heist film this century
item.description: The theft of several royal treasures at the Louvre on Monday was not the first museum jewellery heist this century to resemble a Hollywood movie. Here's a look back at two infamous capers to steal near-priceless jewels.

item.title: Access to road accident compensation for Indigenous Australians is falling short, study says
item.description: A first-of-its-kind South Australian study finds access to compensation after a road accident is not good enough for First Nations people.

item.title: Mark Nawaqanitawase becomes dual international as Kangaroos name Ashes Test squad
item.description: Ex-Wallabies winger Mark Nawaqanitawase and Reece Walsh are among four players named to make their debuts for Australia in the opening Ashes rugby league Test against England.

item.title: Unsuccessful independent's $2m election campaign spend highest in Australia
item.description: An MP says new donation caps on political groups such as Climate 200 mean the days of independents spending up to $2 million on election campaigns are "gone".

item.title: Official list of Sydney's cleanest and most polluted beaches in annual Beachwatch report
item.description: As Sydney prepares to swelter, the city's beaches have been graded — and two local government areas dominate the list for cleanliness.

item.description: Some Australians would rather stay home and talk to an AI bot than go out with friends, according to a YouGov survey.

item.title: Millions of red crabs begin annual migration on Christmas Island as numbers 'skyrocket'
item.description: Christmas Island residents are once again sharing their home with millions of red crabs as they make their way to the ocean, with their numbers having "skyrocketed" in recent years.

item.title: How Boomers deal with big paydays and LeBron's possible last season among five things to watch as NBA returns
item.description: Two young Aussies have gotten paid, teams continue to plot to take down the Thunder and LeBron's future continues to be a talking point. Here are five things to keep an eye on as the NBA season gets underway.

item.title: UCI Track Cycling World Championships in Chile aims to bring velodrome racing back in from the cold
item.description: As the UCI Track Cycling World Championships get underway at the Velódromo de Peñalolén in Santiago this week, the Australian team aims to overcome its geographical limitations and lack of racing to claim gold.

item.title: Queensland's fluoride fear to leave lasting impact on dental health for generations to come
item.description: Many people would say the benefits of fluoride in water are clear but in this state it's often not there and there will be lasting health impacts.

item.title: Alice Springs women face long waits for IUD birth control
item.description: IUDs can be inserted by GPs, gynaecologists and family planning doctors, but in Alice Springs there aren't enough local professionals trained to do so.

item.title: Australian 'admiral' peddling disaster donation relief scheme exposed as 'fake'
item.description: A NSW man has claimed to be an admiral for 25 years while peddling a disaster relief scheme, but he has never served in the navy.

item.title: NT government launches investigation into energy giant Inpex's potentially toxic emissions error
item.description: The NT government has opened an investigation into oil and gas giant Inpex after the company admitted it has been under-reporting potentially toxic emissions from its flagship Ichthys LNG plant on Darwin Harbour.

item.title: Photographer Shane Batham settles action against Hamilton Island operators over art classes
item.description: Shane Batham confidentially settles a court action against the operators of Hamilton Island over claims that an art class reproduced his photos without permission.

item.title: ASX falls from record high as gold and silver prices plunge — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market falls after the spot price of gold and silver experienced their worst single day in years, all while solid corporate earnings on Wall Street drove the Dow Jones index to its highest level ever.

item.title: Tasmania Police find body believed to be missing Mt Field bushwalker Daryl Fong
item.description: A body, believed to be that of missing bushwalker Daryl Fong, has been found after more than a week of searching in Mount Field National Park.

item.title: Trump and Putin's Budapest summit on hold after rejection of immediate Ukraine ceasefire
item.description: President Donald Trump's plan for a swift meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin is on hold in the latest twist in his stop-and-go effort to resolve the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Critics question how $13 billion US–Australia critical minerals deal will benefit WA
item.description: Western Australia's slice of the critical minerals deal is being heralded as a huge win, but critics are asking how much US aluminium giant Alcoa's boon will benefit Western Australians.

item.title: Pilbara communities disconnected from culture, health services due to road damage
item.description: Indigenous elders and advocates fear worsening roads in the Pilbara, which are littered with the rusted skeletons of abandoned cars, are isolating remote residents.

item.title: Temperatures soar in NSW as cyclone-strength winds batter Victoria and SA
item.description: Temperatures are soaring in NSW, while Victorian and South Australian residents are bracing for powerful wind gusts on a day of wild weather.

item.title: Victoria Police Chief Commissioner apologises for using Air Wing helicopter to fly to Tasmania
item.description: The chief commissioner of Victoria Police says the use of a police helicopter for a work trip to Tasmania "creates a poor impression".

item.title: After learning to walk and talk again, Laura is walking 50km in October to raise money for the RFDS
item.description: After surviving a car crash and a stroke, Laura McKenney was told she may never walk again. Now, she's trekking 50-kilometres to raise money for the service that saved her life.

item.title: Acting electoral commissioner labels WA council elections successful despite concerns
item.description: The acting head of WA's Electoral Commission is lauding the recent local council poll as a success, despite reports of missing ballot papers and low voter turnout.

item.title: Australian flower growers want shoppers to know where their blooms originate
item.description: About half of Australia's cut flowers are imported, but there is no requirement to add a label informing consumers of their origin.

item.title: Donald rare earth mine given major project status by Australian government
item.description: The federal government grants major project status to a joint Australian-US mine in regional Victoria.

item.title: Inquest probes death in custody of Phillip Walton at Casino Police Station
item.description: A senior police officer defends the actions of officers during the violent arrest of a man who later died in custody at Casino Police Station in 2023.

item.title: Blind baby wombat Gundy adapts to new home at wildlife sanctuary
item.description: Gundy the wombat suffered vision loss after his mother was killed by a car while he was in her pouch. Wildlife carers are finding creative ways to give him a new chance at life.

item.title: Trump says he did not want to have a 'wasted meeting' with Putin
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Regional cultural icon Anita's Theatre celebrates 100 years of entertainment
item.description: After starting life as a movie theatre and later a roller-skating rink, it was the bold vision of a Wollongong property developer that turned the 100-year-old Anita's Theatre in Thirroul into a cultural icon.

item.title: Gregory John Walker pleads guilty to unlawfully killing boy in Waterloo house fire in 1998
item.description: The boy's mother Julie Szabo watched on as her son's killer uttered the words "I'm guilty", 27 years after her teenage son died in a firebombing in Sydney's Waterloo.

item.title: Survey finds majority of Victorian renters face problems — but not nearly as many lodge a complaint
item.description: A survey of 1,000 Victorian renters finds nearly four in five households faced a tenancy issue over a 12-month period — but only half of them escalated the issue by lodging a complaint.

item.title: Minjee Lee joined by Hannah Green and Grace Kim in Australian team at International Crown
item.description: Minjee Lee, Hannah Green and Grace Kim will lead a powerful Australian line-up at the prestigious women's golf's International Crown team event in South Korea.

item.title: North Korea fires ballistic missiles a week before leaders meet in South Korea
item.description: The launch comes days before South Korea hosts APEC and world leaders including the US and Chinese presidents.

item.title: Sussan Ley backtracks on call for Kevin Rudd to be sacked as US ambassador
item.description: After a Liberal colleague calls Sussan Ley's claim that Kevin Rudd cannot remain US ambassador "churlish", the opposition leader walks back from her call.

item.title: Christmas Island's red crab migration underway
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: INTERPOL issues worldwide alert for 'priceless royal jewels' stolen from the Louvre
item.description: INTERPOL has circulated a "special edition poster" alerting police worldwide to "priceless" stolen Louvre jewels, which French authorities have valued at $157 million.

item.title: Man charged after running over dog, crashing caravan with children inside
item.description: A 59-year-old man is taken to hospital under police guard after crashing an allegedly stolen caravan. A family's dog was run over during the incident in the Gold Coast hinterland.

item.title: Rock climbers' celebrations crushed as government confirms Grampians, Arapiles bans
item.description: The Victorian government clarifies rock climbing bans remain in place in the Grampians and other sites after a message spread online that the bans "were off".

item.title: Red crabs make their annual march on Christmas Island
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: SA government requests review of Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis's parole decision
item.description: South Australia's Attorney-General has called for a review of the decision to release Snowtown killer James Vlassakis on parole, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Man charged in Melbourne after police seize dozens of Labubu dolls
item.description: Police seize Labubu dolls found during a search at a property in Melbourne's west. The dolls, worth an estimated $9,000, were allegedly stolen from a CBD shopping centre.

item.title: Red crabs make their annual march on Christmas Island
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: China accuses Australia of twisted 'propaganda' over Paracel Islands airspace
item.description: Beijing ramps up criticisms of Australia over a tense military encounter over the South China Sea on Sunday, accusing the Australian Defence Force of distributing "twisted and absurd propaganda" and "provoking" China.

item.title: Mysterious military shipwreck appears on Target Beach in Jervis Bay
item.description: Remnants of a shipwreck in Jervis Bay have maritime archaeologists puzzled and wondering what else could be nearby.

item.title: Lidia Thorpe refers NT attorney-general to corruption watchdog
item.description: Senator Lidia Thorpe refers Northern Territory's attorney-general to the corruption watchdog after allegations of government interference in the NT Supreme Court's media activities that were later deemed "a misunderstanding".

item.title: Hot weather records broken across parts of Sydney and NSW, with damaging winds forecast
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology expects damaging winds across the state's south-east in the late afternoon and evening, including gusts of up to 100 kilometres per hour in some parts.

item.title: 'Climate trigger' formally ruled out of environment laws
item.description: A "climate trigger" that could be used to block coal and gas projects has been formally excluded from the government's overhaul of Australia's environment laws, minister Murray Watt confirms.

item.title: Chris Scott says Geelong's recruitment of Bailey Smith is an 'outrageous success'
item.description: Geelong and Victoria coach Chris Scott gets on the offensive about his star midfielder Bailey Smith while urging fans and pundits not to over-react when State of Origin returns next year.

item.title: Rex Airlines creditors seek answers as sale to US company Air T moves closer
item.description: Creditors owed millions of dollars remain in the dark despite a new owner being found for the embattled airline.

item.title: Melbourne Cup lead-in race, Geelong Cup, postponed due to strong winds
item.description: The Geelong Cup has been postponed as strong wind gusts persist, with organisers scrambling to reschedule the key Melbourne Cup lead-in race.

item.title: Telstra testing reveals some Samsung mobile phones unable to make triple-0 calls
item.description: Some Samsung mobile phone users may be unable to call triple-0 in an emergency after Telstra announced testing had revealed more than 70 models were not connecting correctly.

item.title: Donald Day Jr, US conspiracy theorist connected to Wieambilla killers, formally enters plea deal
item.description: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli says the crime "rocked the state", and the news would "hurt" the families of those murdered at Wieambilla.

item.title: Two dead as severe weather across Victoria downs trees, cuts power and postpones Geelong Cup
item.description: Two men have died in rough waters off Frankston as part of the state recorded wind gusts up to 130 kilometres per hour during a severe weather system.

item.title: I moved from Brisbane to the outback at 18 to work on sheep stations
item.description: Art Cooper was almost a year into a panel-beating apprenticeship in Brisbane when he realised it wasn't the career for him, so he packed his belongings and drove 1,300 kilometres to the outback to work as a rouseabout on sheep stations.

item.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride charged with further counts of assault
item.description: Member for MacKillop Nick McBride is facing another three counts of assault dating back to January and September of 2024.

item.title: Investigation into Townsville Hospital urology care finds more impacted patients
item.description: Tim Nicholls says an investigation, launched in September, identified that 11 patients were adversely affected, but that number had since more than doubled.

item.title: Advocate lodges complaint after accessibility issues at Disability Minister Mark Butler's office
item.description: A viral video showing a lack of accessibility into the offices of the federal minister for disability has highlighted broader issues for access into public buildings, an advocate says.

item.title: Our homes are full of hidden microplastics that could be harming our health
item.description: Microplastics are everywhere, including our bodies and brains, and the exposure risk may be highest within our own homes.

item.title: Attorney-General says ABC program is no friend of the NT
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NT politicians call for inquiry into Australia's de facto online gambling regulator
item.description: More than 40 of Australia's corporate bookmakers are based in the Northern Territory for its low taxes and what critics describe as weak regulation.

item.title: Canberra boy's parents detail impact of former childcare worker Muhammad Ali's sexual abuse
item.description: Former childcare worker Muhammad Ali, 31, will be sentenced for the 2022 abuse of the boy on Thursday.

item.title: Queensland nurses and midwives vote overwhelmingly in favour of new $1.8 billion pay deal
item.description: The vote comes after 10 months of negotiations which led to about 45,000 nurses and midwives taking part in industrial action for the first time in more than 20 years.

item.title: Woman injured in army truck collision north-west of Brisbane
item.description: Emergency services were called to reports of a crash between an army truck and a car north-west of Brisbane on Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Tonga rugby league team meets with king ahead of Test match against Samoa in Brisbane
item.description: Lunch with the king of Tonga and quality time spent with his subjects have Jason Taumalolo primed to deliver a blockbusting display against Samoa.

item.title: OpenAI launches Atlas web browser to compete with Google's Chrome
item.description: The owner of ChatGPT, OpenAI, launches its own web browser, Atlas, as more people rely on artificial intelligence to answer questions on the internet.

item.title: The 'peppercorn' lease deal that allows Prince Andrew to live in the Royal Lodge virtually rent free
item.description: Prince Andrew is facing growing pressure from British ministers and senior politicians to give up his lifelong possession of a grand mansion on the grounds of Windsor Castle.

item.title: An army truck rolled over north-west of Brisbane.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NSW Police officer charged with 'more serious' offence over Hannah Thomas arrest
item.description: The police officer charged with allegedly assaulting former Greens candidate Hannah Thomas is now facing an additional, more serious, offence.

item.title: Op shop purchase of The Hobbit could be worth tens of thousands if verified as first edition Tolkien
item.description: A woman who bought a copy of The Hobbit from an op shop in the 1990s says even then she suspected it could be worth a considerable amount — experts now say she could be sitting on a first edition copy, worth tens of thousands.

item.title: Man flown to hospital, six others injured in road crash in Oakford, in Perth's south
item.description: Seven people are taken to hospital including a baby and a critically injured man after two cars collided in the southern Perth suburb of Oakford.

item.title: Australian official to join Trump-led Gaza peace taskforce
item.description: The official will participate in planning and coordination efforts related to humanitarian and security challenges in implementing the ceasefire.

item.title: Emergency services were on scene on Wednesday afternoon
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mate Stipinovich, Aristides Avlontis, Karl Whitburn jailed for bungled Albany drug smuggling attempt
item.description: Three men forced to cling to an esky to survive in wild seas off Albany as they tried to import hundreds of kilograms of cocaine into Western Australia are described by a judge as "Keystone criminals" at their sentencing.

item.title: How worried should we be about microplastics in our homes?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Inquest into deaths of Stanley Obi and Sarah Mudge hears of events during hours before fire
item.description: The mother of a woman who allegedly broke into her former partner’s home and set it alight, before dying in the fire herself, gives evidence at a coronial inquest.

item.title: Australia vs England, Women's Cricket World Cup, live scores, stats, ball by ball
item.description: Led by stand-in captain Tahlia McGrath, Australia will seek to re-establish itself at the top of the Women's Cricket World Cup standings.

item.title: Supreme Court in Brisbane reserves decision on Queensland's puberty blocker freeze after legal challenge
item.description: The mother of a trans teenager launched legal action over the state's freeze on puberty blockers earlier this year.

item.title: Delegates discussed 'getting rid' of land council boss during men's meeting, court hears
item.description: A defamation trial over a press release issued by Northern Territory senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has been derailed by an "unusual and significant" application to have a man barred from the court.

item.title: Diamonds dominate Silver Ferns to take 2-0 lead in Constellation Cup series
item.description: Australia is one win away from regaining the Constellation Cup after dominating New Zealand in the second netball Test match in Sydney.

item.title: AC Milan Serie A game will be played in Perth despite backlash, deputy premier says
item.description: The state government is doubling down on its plan to bring European football heavyweights AC Milan to Perth to play a historic Italian league game, despite significant backlash from fans and players.
